environment_mappings.comment: Many biomes could potentially be host-associated environments, depending on the specific host organism being considered. The mappings here represent some common possibilities, but the list is not exhaustive.

onto_term_mappings.comment: A forest biome could be a host-associated environment, for example in the case of arboreal animals or epiphytes living on trees.
onto_term_mappings.specificity_justification: Forests can host many symbiotic relationships, but it is not a defining characteristic of all forests.

onto_term_mappings.comment: A woodland biome could be a host-associated environment, for example in the case of animals or epiphytes living on or among the widely spaced trees.
onto_term_mappings.specificity_justification: Woodlands can host many symbiotic relationships, but it is not a defining characteristic of all woodlands.

onto_term_mappings.comment: A shrubland biome could be a host-associated environment, for example in the case of animals living in or among the shrubs.
onto_term_mappings.specificity_justification: Shrublands can host many symbiotic relationships, but it is not a defining characteristic of all shrublands.

onto_term_mappings.comment: A grassland biome could be a host-associated environment, for example in the case of animals grazing on the grasses or living in burrows.
onto_term_mappings.specificity_justification: Grasslands host many animal and plant symbiotic relationships, but it is not a defining characteristic.

onto_term_mappings.comment: A savanna biome could be a host-associated environment, for example in the case of animals grazing on the grasses or living among the scattered trees.
onto_term_mappings.specificity_justification: Savannas host many animal and plant symbiotic relationships, but it is not a defining characteristic.

onto_term_mappings.comment: A desert biome could be a host-associated environment, for example in the case of animals adapted to the arid conditions.
onto_term_mappings.specificity_justification: Deserts can host symbiotic relationships, particularly between plants and microbes, but it is not a defining characteristic.

onto_term_mappings.comment: A tundra biome could be a host-associated environment, for example in the case of animals adapted to the cold conditions.
onto_term_mappings.specificity_justification: Tundra can host symbiotic relationships, particularly between plants and microbes, but it is not a defining characteristic.

onto_term_mappings.comment: A mangrove biome could be a host-associated environment, for example in the case of animals living among the mangrove trees or in the tidal waters.
onto_term_mappings.specificity_justification: Mangroves host many symbiotic relationships, particularly between plants and microbes and animals, but it is not a defining characteristic.

Forests are defined by their plant communities.
Woodlands are defined by their sparse tree communities.
Shrublands are defined by their dense shrub communities.
Grasslands are defined by their grass communities.
Savannas are defined by their grass and tree communities.
Mangroves are defined by their unique plant communities adapted to coastal environments.
Temperate broadleaf forests are defined by their broadleaf tree communities.

Temperate mixed forests are defined by their mix of broadleaf and coniferous tree communities.
Temperate shrublands are defined by their dense shrub communities.

Croplands are defined by their cultivated plant communities.
Rangelands are typically grasslands or shrublands, and thus are defined in part by their plant communities.
